Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located in Edgeley, Stockport and occupies a highly prominent location on Castle Street, Edgeley’s main retail high street. Retailers within the immediate vicinity include Boots, Co-operative Food, Sue Ryder and Greggs together with a large number of independent traders. Stockport’s mainline rail station approach is within 10 minutes’ walk and the M60 motorway is within a few minutes’ drive.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over Ground and First floor. The ground floor comprises main banking hall, staff counter, 4x meeting rooms and back office. The First floor comprises staff room, male and female W/C, and ancillary storage space.

Tenure
The property is currently held on a lease expiring 10/02/2021

Rent
The current rent passing is £22,500 per annum, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £18,500.00 and the rates payable are £9,083.50 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Located directly opposite Stockport Train Station, 2 Stockport Exchange
benefits from high footfall from commuting passengers. Stockport Train Station offers unbeatable connectivity. A train will get you to Manchester Piccadilly in eight minutes – cross to the other platform to be at London
Euston in just under two hours. Nearby occupiers and amenities include
Sainsburys Local, Café Lito, Holiday Inn, Life Leisure and a multi-storey NCP car park.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Ground floor retail and leisure unit(s) below a state-of-the-art workspace in the heart of Stockport town centre, providing a large open space that is both light and airy. It’s the perfect environment for any retail and leisure occupier. There is the possibility for the unit to be sub-divided into two or three units.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £ and the rates payable are £ pa. The UBR for 2021/2022 is p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Stockport is a large town in Greater Manchester about 7 miles to the south east of Manchester City Centre and 35 miles to the west of Sheffield.

The unit is situated on Princes Street, part of the Merseyway Shopping centre, Stockport’s prime retail destination.

The centre is anchored by Primark, Boots and Marks & Spencer with national retailers including Top Shop and JD Sports.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Tenure
The premises are offered on a new, 15 year, fully repairing and insuring lease.

Rent
£40,000 per annum.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £11,750.00 and the rates payable are £5,640.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 48.00p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property is located in Reddish which is a suburb of Stockport.
The building is located on the pedestrianised Houldsworth Square and forms part of the main shopping area of Reddish. Close by is a large Morrisons superstore.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property comprises ground floor and first floor. The ground floor is fitted out as a banking hall with the first floor comprising staff room and storage.

Tenure
The property is currently held on a lease expiring 24/12/2022

Price
The current rent passing is £15,500 per annum, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable value of the property is £11,000. The UBR for 2020/2021 is 49.9p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Just 2 miles south west of Manchester city centre No1 Old Trafford has multiple transport links into Manchester and beyond. MediacityUK and Salford Quays are less than 1 mile away and can be reached on foot via the paved canal towpath and footbridges in less than 20 minutes. The new Trafford Park Metrolink Line opened in March 2020 and provides access to Manchester City Centre in 15 minutes, the Trafford Centre is just 5 stops away and takes 20 minutes. The A5081 and A56 roadways are a stones throw away, providing access to the Manchester inner ring road, the M60 ring road and M602.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
A prime site fronting the Manchester ship canal with excellent accessibility to the new Wharfside Metrolink tram stop. Just across the road to the south of the site is O2 Victoria Warehouse, a popular event space with a capacity of 3,500 people. Further, Old Trafford Football Ground and Hotel Football are less than 500 metres from the development. Various office developments, including Soapworks and Exchange Quay are within walking distance, as well as White City retail park.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £ and the rates payable are £ pa. The UBR for 2021/2022 is p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Premium offers sought for this valuable lease

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property provides a prominent corner location on Cross Street, an established retail street within Manchester City Centre linking prime Market Street and King Street. Nearby occupiers include Sainsbury’s, Pret a Manger, Patagonia & Diesel.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property compromises ground and basement premises with a return frontage onto St Ann Street.

Tenure
The property is held on an FRI lease expiring 6th February 2021.

Rent
A passing rent of £90,000per annum exclusive.

Terms
Offers are invited in respect of TSB’s leasehold interest.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the local rating authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £96,000 and the rates payable are £47,328 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 49.3p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.
